intro: Narenga fallax, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, reed-like stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters at the top of the stems. Narenga fallax is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in weaving traditional Maori baskets. Its fibrous leaves are also used in the production of textiles and paper.
